alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Ritchie; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ritchie, central Doddridge and southeastern Tyler Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Union, or 12 miles northeast of Harrisville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Union, New Milton, Alma, Smithburg, Mountain, Lima, Greenwood, Blandville, Center Point, Avon and Canton. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 44 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
